header.title: Ageism in the LGBT Community
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: Feeling generous? Like the video and share if you agree! :-) Follow me on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/DannyyJ_

commentThread.commentText:
For my experience I am a black medium Carmel skin complexion tone  short soft looking black guy and I am 35 year old I am over looked or seen as object I don't know where I fit in at I am look too young or I am too old and as a gay black I am tired of being the scapegoat of the world.
.
I wonder how the youth obsessed 18-25 year olds of today will feel in 10 or 15 years time.

Honestly I lie about my age on apps, once you hit thirty people act like you're a shriveled old man. I dont even look thirty, but just the fact that the number is on my profile disqualifies me in the minds of so many damn guys. Its ridiculous how damn picky the gay community is, while at the same time always complaining they cant find a life partner when all they go for is stud muffins with nothing to offer besides looks. In the gay community, if you are young and beautiful and physically fit, you can get away with literal murder among gays.

I'm 52 and the issue for me about getting older is not about the younger guys, it is about the guys my age or older not wanting to be with men close to their age. I prefer to be with men around my age but a lot of them want younger guys!

Hi Danny, very interesting video - I myself am a 48 years old out Irish gay male, originally from a little village about 20 miles from Dublin (and I also lived in Dublin for 3 years), currently living in Manchester here in the UK since 2002 but I too have been discriminated against from other gay  men, including on the Dublin gay scene, even at gay pride events, where I have found that other gay men have been my worst bullies to date - I simply gave up trying to interact with any male (gay or straight) more than 5 years younger than myself, because of the judgemental attitudes that I encountered from other gay men, even here in Manchester and yet, on my frequent visits home to Ireland, I do not have the same kind of non-acceptance from my family and friends back home that I do from other gay men, despite the fact that I am also a devout Mass-going Catholic, where my being gay is fully accepted in my Catholic parish and faith community, both back home in Ireland and here in the UK - in fact, when I go home to Ireland, I visit a group of enclosed Poor Clare Sisters in their Convent in Dublin and in speaking to the Sisters through the grille, they are fully accepting of my being gay, where they were my late father’s former employers, as my extended family and friends have a lot of personal connections to Catholic religious orders and congregations of Priests, Brothers, Monks, Friars and Nuns - when I was growing up, I was always taught about Catholic “faith and morals” including in relation to my being gay, but this thing about discrimination and prejudice within the LGBT community is in itself an issue of morality in terms of how we treat other people - how can we possibly champion the rights and equality of and for LGBT people globally when we treat each other so badly, making ourselves look like hypocrites

ive been treated worse by other gay men than any other group because my age. i like being 50. we are cool people and we dont have to be accepted. i learned as i got older to not worry about what other gay men think. irrational behavior is not good for both straight and gays. expecting someone to like you is irrational. should,could, must are irrational words. i dont have any friends, am a black sheep of the family, so i make up my own way of fun and entertainment. dont need others approval. that is the problem for us gay men. we want society to accept us. most of society dont. i dont let it bother me. i only fight if someone gets in my space and like to cause trouble. i quit being pacifist in that respect because hate is hate and i will not put up with it.
It is nice to know that Filipinos are not so Age Prejudiced or in other ways like the so-called "more civilized" West.

Ageism, among other things, is DEFINITELY an issue amongst gay men. Yet, in many ways, we only have OURSELVES to blame. We put so much value on being young that we don't embrace the reality that we will grow older, and embrace that reality with respect. For many gay men, aging has an element of karma. They know how they treated older men in the past, and now they see that they are getting older and realizing that their time in the sun is coming to an end. 

I, myself, am 38, and I would totally prefer to date or be in relationship with someone my age. However, there are many men who are my age that are dealing with a great deal of emotional damage and fear because of their experiences as being gay. I fear that we are seeing a vicious cycle with gay men and aging, among other things. I pray that we find a way to collectively make changes.

replies.commentText: Brent Foster i understand. when i was 17 years old i dated a 38 year old man. didnt care what others thought.

commentThread.commentText: Hi you ok so long haven't seen your vids in ages hope all's good x

I'm 30 but look a fair bit younger (many people assume I'm about college-age, 22 or so). I'm primarily attracted to younger guys around 18-22 or so and always have been (when I was younger and they were older than me, those were also the ages I liked), but I've begun misrepresenting my age on dating sites lately because people have used my age as a reason not to talk to me. I don't always use such apps for dating either, I'm also looking for friends, and I like to talk about my various interests such as writing, languages, electronic music, and learning about other cultures and perspectives. 

I also think it's vitally important that younger people have older friends and vice versa, especially in the gay community, where we sometimes still face a lot of prejudice depending on where you live or what your situation is. We ALL need that kind of support and to come together as equals, regardless of petty little differences like age. We can't afford to exclude one another, in the same way society over the years has excluded us and other people who were different or didn't fit into their box. 

That doesn't mean you can't have standards or be attracted to the kind of people you are. But at least keep an open mind about friendships and realize that not everyone is out to creep on you or hurt you, and many just want to protect you. 

As another side of this too however, I just want to point out that some younger gay men are attracted to older and vice versa as well, and neither party should be ashamed of that. If both parties are consenting and within the boundaries of the law, there's nothing wrong with it and fuck what anyone says.

replies.commentText: +Peter von Harten - Let me get this straight. People won't talk to you because you're "too old." So you lie about your age -- two wrongs equal a right. And what happens when said people find out your real age...and why would you want to befriend such shallow people anyway?

commentThread.commentText: It just goes to show that the LGBT community is not as inclusive as they preach themselves to be.

replies.commentText: 1958mlvc very true. now this adds fodder to christian people for not liking us. homosexual pornography sadly influences the males on the "ideal" male type.

commentThread.commentText: Great video/ I'm 41 and luckily look younger. However I feel the prejudice will begin soon. Is good to see someone younger with a decent polite attitude. Good for you.
Thank you

I'm pushing 70 and I'm considering putting up vlogs about what's gone on in the gay community for the last 50 years.  And I wish kids would look up the word pedophile and quit referring to guys of legal age who like older men as weird.

replies.commentText: I would totally watch those videos.  I think it would be something unique to YouTube, or at least rare.  A very interesting proposition.
oaksong I would love to watch that as well. I'm 30 and would love to see your perspective.

iam 31 .....its not young ..not old ...but average ....but can that age fit for teen .....

replies.commentText: I was 32 when I started dating an 18 yo boy. We dated for a year before I let him move in. We were together for 25 years.

I"m doing it too fell in love with a 20 years younger boy/man, he likes his man bit older , i like my man little younger. the 20 years difference scared me to death , but after a while and now almost living together , we are stronger than most other couples we know.

commentThread.commentText: thank you Danny. I watch a lot of "coming out" videos, primarily because a young gay guy I knew very well, killed himself after being rejected by his family. I don't ever want to see or hear of that happening again and I pledged after coming home from his funeral that I would do anything in my power to prevent it from happening again. Yes I do get the usual brainless comments now and the from those I'd hope would know better. But the end goal is all that concerns me. if I can help in any small way to stop even one person from taking their life,  I'll happily take all the abuse in the world. Thanks so much for showing what a fine young man you are. x
imagine a 70 year old rejecting  you cause your 58 and that is not  young. Of course   you can't make men like  you if they don't .

i was just rejected the 100th time on grindr  cause of my age .in gay,,com there are men interested in me but they are desperate  for husband or lovers and are taking advantage of my age .I been less rejected in the gay brick and mortar world

Ageism certainly is real among some that can't imagine themselves one day being in that same demographic. If some of your young viewers comment here about their feelings in what sounds discriminatory towards us it might be helpful for them to not just understand that if they're lucky they too will become members of an aged population but that it would be measurably beneficial for our society as a whole if they were to visit a senior care facility and take note of what really happens as one ages. It's a sad truth that as you live your life having a large social circle in your teens and through to what some may refer to as middle life, that change is in the wind. As each decade there after passes you eventually lose contact with so many that once you knew and even considered to be your "friends" through natural attrition which obviously includes the fate of mortality. Thanks for understanding how one such as myself that has one maybe two and on a stretch three friends at this stage of my life (I'm 59) that at times when I'm alone and search for what is currently happening I find this medium of YouTube to be quite inspirational. Comments made such as this one by myself are for me a way of having a chance to speak freely and hopefully have a virtual connection with others even if I never receive a "Like" ...it, YouTube is an outlet, a way of connecting of understanding and of revisiting our own youthful past.  Best wishes to all....

Danny I came across this video about Ageism in the LGBT community while doing research for a college paper. I wanted you to know how appreciative I am of someone who is younger that acknowledges and shows empathy towards the older "gays" in our community. Thank you so much for this video and any information I use from your video in my paper will be given to you.
I don't care what people say, if you're white, younger or older, there's still a broader audience for you. Try being black or asian and older. Most of us are completely INVISIBLE!

replies.commentText: Jhad Amen which is why as a gay man I don't really feel as if I'm a part of the "mainstream" gay community.

Jhad True. LGBT people of color are invisible for the simple reason that a certain segment of the “gay community” doesn’t want to see anyone who is considered undesirable and, you guessed correctly, anyone who happens to be over 40, non- white and doesn’t fit the stereotype of “male attractiveness”, which although subjective still tends to be “young and male “, although youth is the main factor.... regardless of race or ethnicity. Sad but true.

commentThread.commentText: Again very good ,age comes to us all very quickly
I completely agree! Love this, love you, love your makeup!

I'm one of the "older gays"  I watch video by younger gays mostly out of admiration and a bit of jealousy.  Younger gays have no idea of the intensity of the discrimination and hate we had to go through with no way to talk to anyone about it.  You younger guys have no idea of how truly lucky you are to have YouTube and the ability to share your feelings and experiences.  I'll continue to watch and enjoy your freedom and wish I had the same at your age.  Please include us

I don't usually make comments  however your video was was well presented. As you can see I'm up there in age and I admire you're youth. And how at one time I look like that when I was a young man. I really appreciate your comments towards older males. Thank you Danny and good luck with your life.
this is so true... http://ledramaqueer.blogspot.com/2014/03/ageism-in-gay-world.html

I was born in 1942, and I came out at a time when doing that was even riskier than now.  So, I could not start forming friendships, either gay OR straight, when my personal development needed to do that.  Today, I am blessed with a same-sex partner within throwing distance of my age.  Youtube is my only way of following the GLBT community, even a little.  Of course, there is TowleRoad, thankfully.

I totally agree that there's ageism in the gay community. That being said, honestly, what could SO many men twice and three times your age possibly have in common with someone your age? Personally, I think that, in and of itself is fueling and perpetuating exactly the ageism they're complaining about. If everyone focused their attention on their own age range (no age gaps comparable to father and son) there wouldn't be issues.

replies.commentText: jetsetfool You also have to consider that times were different for older gays when they were young men as opposed to how things are now. It's a lot of missed time and opportunities for older men. I completely agree with what you're saying but at the same time it's easier said than done. Plus you can't police who older gay men want to associate with.

commentThread.commentText: I think I like you even more for this video. So genuine. I'm so happy for you, enjoy France and Japan.

Ur eyes ur face ur alse like ajwref said well spoken and sensible.
You are PERFECT. So where do u live ;)
Yea USA is so totally moral,that explains the rampent crime.Try again.

its true for 99.9 % of younger gay guys that they are absolutly rude and disrespectful to oldrer gay guys....and to be honest it speaks volumes about the so caled gay"communitty".There are exceptions however (thank God).The only justice for those that arnt a exception is that they will feel it soon enough.
Wow,  your very bright for a young man........Wait until your close to 70,  see all the younger people treated well,  while the older people like my age, are passed by..

What a wonderful video, as an older gay male I have seen more than my fair share of ageism in the gay community and I think it's wonderful you are bringing it to everyones attention.

I would like to say however I see ageism in western society as a whole. Many kids today treat their elders like a burden or a nuisance, there's definitely a lack of respect. It seems when their parents get old they can't wait to get them put in a home, it really saddens me.

Aloha
The comments that your read from your other video really hit home for me.  I get very encouraged by young people who have come out and be comfortable in their sexuality.  I suffered in the closet for over 30 years before I could accept my sexuality and come out to others.  

Please keep up your honest vlog.  You have power.  

Namaste,
Dave
Welcome to being BLACK, everyday!

I am 19 and get discriminated against by gay peers my age already so I can only imagine what it would be like when I was older... It's time for us gays to grow up and realize that we are all people with feelings and to treat others the way we would like to treat ourselves. Maybe gays are so used to being hated on that we can easily hate as well but I will always treat others the only way: The polite way. (whether they are 18 or 80)

Well speaking as an older gay man, has it ever occured to some of the younger gay guys that we have had more fun in our time than you have had hot dinners? This older gay man is happy being in his forties (the secret is to broaden your horizons in real life and move away from an exclusive gay social life - which gets a bit boring after a few years anyways) ... I love permaculture, wildlife conservation volunteering, cycling and have found wonderful straight friends through common interests.
It true, old gay people treated like shit and sadly most of a time LGBT Community rejected them. So, what learn to be gay is..... start a family and being a monogamous relationship.

This was an amazing video, and a topic that rarely, if ever, gets addressed. But you nailed it. It's unfortunate but also so true. I see it all the time. And it hurts. I'm not that way. Just want to help. But kids always assume I'm a paedo. I've never issued a lewd comment or tried to spend time alone with anyone but kids are so programmed by their parents, teachers, and the media, they just see paedos everywhere. Thank you for addressing this, rather painful, issue. cheers

(3of3) Age may have its advantages of knowledge but that goes both ways, us older people can learn from you the younger generations as well. "It may seem being Homosexual should not be difficult in a liberal and educated society, but do not forget that every society tailors for Heterosexuals, no matter how modern it." So I think it is a learning experience regardless of Age.

(2of3) A couple standing close to me where giving me the evil eye for most of the night. I guess I looked much older, greying beard and a walking stick, but when my friend came sat next to me, place his hand on my leg well the look from them was like I committed murder. By that time I had enough and went to say something but my friend asked me not too.  I can only say faced with "Ageism" both in public and online it’s not a great feeling.

(1of3) Well done on the video. I have come across possible "Ageism" 2 times that I am aware of, both at my cities only gay nightclub. Last time was just an evil glare by 2 young guyz, sitting about 2 metres away. I learned to ignore those sorts of incidences but my first time was when I took a young  friend there for his first experience to a gay nightclub. I was there for support so he'd feel comfortable knowing he was not alone. I was about 45 at the time.

What annoys me though is that whenever I go on a gay chatroom for TEENS, so I can find TEENS my age that are gay and that live in my area, it's always filled with old men... I wish they would go away cause its really annoying.

Thank you so much for making this video. It's an important topic that is very real and prevalent, but in an odd way, I've always just written it off to ignorance without really paying attention to the consequences, and you make a very good point about when you or I (30) are a few decades older and how we'll feel about it then. So thank you for talking about this. I, for one, will pay more attention when this discrimination rears it's head.

I am not *that* old, so I haven't really experienced ageism per se. I have absolutely no problem with older gay men (I have dated a couple of them :)), but I also watch videos by gay teenagers because I never had the courage to come out when I was that age. My teenage years were full of secrecy, uncertainty and loneliness, so watching someone as young and honest and confident as you are just makes me really happy for the younger generation.
Well that's not an entirely true assumption, I'm 16 and Gay! x

:-) Sounds good to me....an invasion of the Elders, as it were....I think it's perfectly acceptable (and, understandable) that each person has a general "age range" that they're attracted to, but, that doesn't give anyone the right to be rude to those outside that range.Unfortunately, it's all too common.

Hiya PandaManDanny... I am 54 and have not had a relationship for 25 odd years and feel so alone because I have had many comments about my age. I have watched your video's with a great deal of interest. I am viewing generally to find out the attitudes of the younger generation of LGBT community. I love what you put over. Keep it up (that is the video's).....

To be honest I 100% agree with what you're saying & I'm just 16 myself. I believe there is no point in blackballing older Gay men & putting them all in one stereotype & categorising them as pervs, paedo's etc. It's stupid because at the end of the day we are ALL going to be old one day.. But I must say to older men; if you don't want any sexual desires from young men at the club scene then what do you really want when you approach them? (Just Asking a Simple Question)

You are far more mature in your outlook than many other ppl your age.  You have great insight.  I've been going to clubs since I was in my 20's in the 1970's.  I turn 60 this year.  Years ago I gave up caring what anyone else there thinks.  I don't allow my actions to be shaped by the stupidity of others -- no matter what their age!  Now I live in Las Vegas.  Google "Krave Las Vegas" to take a look at a club I now often visit.  It's always a good time.     :-)
That sounds horrible. I don't understand why these people think that they are superior just because they are younger. Thanks for your comment, though :-)
Yes lol!
Hahahah G.B.T & M.B.?

My partner and I made the mistake of visiting a gay club a while back...I was 55 and he's 64. It was like a scene in an old Western movie, when the bad-guy walks into the saloon...it got very, very quiet, and we could feel every eye on us. We sat at the bar for a bit, but, there were just too many almost-whispered comments ("old man sex...ew," was one of the kindest), so, we left. Nice to see that there are at least a few younger guys with intelligence and class. Nice video!

In which case: Apologies and I feel like an idiot.
-_-

I think it's pretty clear that a significant number of older men *do* like younger guys, and may watch your videos at least partly for that reason. The question I would ask, though is: is that in itself really a problem?

What  a sensible and well spoken young man you are and you have a true insight into older gay men.Well done and keep the faith.

beauty is beauty and charming is charming its a HUMAN emotion  not tied to age or anything else... there's what society wants to think we are and then there's reality... he is charming and beautiful i think that anyone would love that so i hope people use their brains and not their guilty ego to judge people :-)

How quickly 'society' forgets that until recently all homosexuals were 'diagnosed' disordered.  The historical norm of adult male attraction for adolescent males has only in recent times become 'creepy' do to the success of Femo-Fascist  Liberation.  Big Mommy/Sister mind-control hypnosis fueled by psychological tearoism is only the latest tactic to undermine self-control in society.  It is logical critical thinking that is the feared contaminant, not age.
thank you  so much from an older gay man.

As a medical diagnosis, pedophilia, or paedophilia, is defined as a psychiatric disorder in persons who are 16 years of age or older typically characterized by a primary or exclusive sexual interest in PREPUBESCENT CHILDREN (generally those under the age of 14, though onset of puberty varies). The PREPUBESCENT CHILD must be at least five years younger than the adolescent before the attraction can be diagnosed as pedophilia.

On a serious note; being "creepy" and being a molester of children isn't the same, I am sure we all agree. If a 17 year old "boy" has a sexual affair with a 28 year old woman, she will not be called a paedophile rapist (maybe in America, who knows). Turn it around and we suddenly have a problem. Make it a homosexual couple and all hell breaks loose. All I ask for in this world is a little consistency.

Very well put and a thoughtful video.  I'm not sure I concur with the concept that if I watch an 18 year old video it makes me a pedophile.  Beauty whether gay or straight is to be admired and unfortunately no one can escape the aging process.  The term pedophile would be appropriate if one lusted for a prepubescent person.

Age has replaced race or other factors as being the acceptable means of being prejudiced against people.  Prejudice means pre-judging.  It's not acceptable to presume someone in a certain way because of their race, but it's socially accepted to do so based on age.  People are more separated based on age than ever.  Kids are kept to their own age group and discouraged from interacting with anyone more than a couple years older or younger, so they're not good at dealing with younger/older people.
Great Video!!!  Keep up the great work you do.

I agree. I'm 26 and still look 20, yet an 18 year-old at the club I used to go to seemed interested in me until I told him my age, at which point he made a disgusted face and walked away. Mind you, this was when I was 22. I often shudder at what's happening in the world these days, especially for those like me who have enjoyed mentoring youth. But as stupid as society can be, it's refreshing and gives me hope that more younger people are realizing that not all older guys are creeps.

I'm 45yo and I feel discriminated against more by younger straight people than younger gay people. In fact you see lot's of inter-generational relationships in the gay community than with straight couples. I think that the young gay guys who are repelled by older gay guys are pretty self centered to think that the older guy is a predator out to get them. I think it is along the same lines as being a straight guy who is afraid of gay men because they think they are going to try to hit on them.

You're well-informed and make for interesting viewing here, proving that not all youngsters are dumb and misguided. I'm 28, gay and the majority of videos I watch on YouTube are of people under 21. I look younger than my age and it's annoying and pathetic that the instant a younger gay guy find out your age that you're either blocked/ignored or suffer childish, ageist abuse and "pervert" accusations. I also have some fantastic young friends that are intelligent enough to understand this.

There are many younger guys who actually find older guys to be quite attractive aesthetically and based on their experience, resulting maturity and hence reliability. And these symbiotic and quite healthy relationships are as old as mankind. People learn their attitudes toward these issues and the derisive social dynamic was carefully designed to weaken societies of all kinds. Due to weak people... it works every time.
That's a really good point! I didn't think of that :-)

A lot of people who watch your videos might have profiles that say they're older than they are because they don't want to have to deal with age restrictions and blocking if they are trying to watch a certain video that's inappropriate or something
I want a gif of 1:37
Amen. LGBTs need to be nicer to one another!

Yep!!!  Spot on mate!!!  I will be 55 at the end of this month (July) and I still can't believe that I've made it this far!!!  I tend to mix well with all ages of people (and always have..) and it really helps me keep things in a more rounded perspective.  And..it's true!  I don't see anyone in my age range making You Tube videos ..Hmmm ...maybe I should change that.  Ahhh ..Just a thought.  Love your on-screen presence and personality ...Keep up the great work!!!  :-)

I agree that there is no "gay community."The word "community" connotes something that is warm, accepting, friendly to its members, and vibrant. What exists is an elitist "gay hierarchy", which is cold, rejecting, and unfriendly to those who are considered unattractive, and which is moribund, because everyone who is at the top of the hierarchy now will be at the bottom of it in a decade or two. It's cruelty undermines support for "gay rights," since  only those currently at the top benefit.
It will be up Sunday, I will tweet you when it is up
Of course you can! I'm glad you want to feature it... thankyou :-)

I would like to add this vid at the end of my blog Sunday.  It is about where ideas come from and I refer back to my previous blog on this topic that you already read.  I trust that is still ok with you.  I liked this vid a lot and you get more specific credit this time!
your jawline. holy ;-;

Wow, this was very great.  I am 34, and being the in between age I definitely agree with how these ill perceptions of older gay men are being personified.  I think it is great that this kind of dialogue undoes the taboo around the different age groups socializing and learning from each other.  For goodness sake, this a form of social media isn't it?!  A platform for people to talk , to be seen and heard.  It IS ridiculous to assume everyone is a sexual predator, and only furthers the stereotype!
Thanyou! :-)
Yep! :-)
Very well said, Danny!!  :)
Great video, I agree 100% ! Subscribed !

Brava, I'm older now, thank god most of my good frs are myage and we intordice our frs to each other.  But I do agree the young kids stay away from the older men.  I don;t disagree with hookups but its unusual that a relationship can occur though.  not enuff same experiences.
thank You...

Danny, I was so impressed by your thoughtful and insightful video.  I am now in my 60th year.  I was 16 at time of Stonewall in NYC.  Back then, being gay was thought to be some kind of mental disease.  I have seen fantastic progress -- even though much slower than I would have preferred.  I continue to make gay and straight friends of ALL ages.  Diversity is beautiful and we should all learn to embrace it in all its dimensions.  We are all human -- we have so VERY much in common due to that!
@DWTSfan10 Yes I am British. And as far as I'm aware, pretty much everyone in the UK says 'peedophile

Hi Danny, I’m kind of new to you tube. I’m 46 gay man & am disabled. I’ve found most users to be much smarter & younger then me. A few I have felt discriminated against. For the majority of users & the gay collaborative channels , I have found great friendships. Thank’s for addressing this issue , us mid to older age people are glad to have young men like you , to be here to help us & in return I’m trying to help anyone I can. Thank’s : Steve :-D

Very thoughtful. Thanks Danny for speaking up in support for older gay men. We are not all perverts even though there are some out there. I subscribe to all gay guys young or older if I like what they have to say. I try to offer support and let them know that they are not alone. I can relate to the younger guys, because when I was younger, I had the same feelings towards older gay men. Now that I'm older and a little wiser, I realize we all need to be accepted and valued for who we are. Thanks again, Danny! <3..
It's no different in the way that heterosexual women are creeped out by old hetero men.

Excellent video. I am an older male. I've never hit on a young gay man. Many people in my generation died of AIDS. There are few older gay men who can help gay youth who may need support -eg those who have been kicked out of their homes for being gay. Many activists died of AIDS, so there are not many people my age making You Tube videos. I watch gay You Tubers of all ages, in hopes to be of encouragement and support.
I'm 18 and I think this is probably very true and needs to be told because younger gay guys will be that age eventually.

Yes, women in general are more susceptible to being discriminated against because of age, although not quite in the same way gay males are. No, why would that be weird?
Im 19 and watch your videos and this one was really brave. I agree older gay men shouldn't be discriminated against.

Well said Danny. As I inch closer to my thirties, im certainly even more aware of the distructive effect ageism has on our community. Its a discussion that needs to had more and more. It frankly tells us alot about how our community in general values itself.
